title: Ustad Zakir Hussain died of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. What is this lung condition? - The Hindu
summary:
Ustad Zakir Hussain died of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. What is this lung condition?

Published on: December 17, 2024 06:00 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

Ustad Zakir Hussain, a legendary tabla maestro and four-time Grammy award winner, passed away at 73 in San Francisco on December 15, 2024, due to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, leaving behind a significant legacy in classical music.

Key Points:

  • IPF is a chronic lung disease characterized by scarring of the lungs, leading to progressively difficult breathing.
  • The cause of IPF is classified as 'idiopathic', meaning unknown, and it is the most common form of pulmonary fibrosis.
  • Risk factors for developing IPF include being a former or current smoker, age (rare under 50), and family history of pulmonary fibrosis.
  • Symptoms can include shortness of breath, persistent dry cough, fatigue, and changes in fingernails.
  • Diagnosis may involve medical history, CT scans, and respiratory tests, while treatment options are limited to slowing disease progression and supportive care.
“Think of the lung as a balloon. IPF hardens the lung tissue, making its elasticity go away.” - R. P. Ilangho, pulmonologist

This news underlines the serious and often misunderstood condition of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, highlighting the importance of awareness and understanding around lung diseases.
newTitle: Ustad Zakir Hussain's Passing and the Lung Condition He Battled

title: Pushpa-2 stampede: Hyderabad police find 11 lapses in Sandhya theatre - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
Hyderabad Police Identify 11 Lapses After Pushpa-2 Stampede at Sandhya Theatre

Publication Date: December 4, 2024, Source: Hyderabad Police

In a tragic incident during the premiere of 'Pushpa 2' at Sandhya 70 MM theatre, a stampede led to the death of a woman and raised serious questions about theatre management and safety protocols.

  • Hyderabad police issued a show cause notice to Sandhya theatre management regarding lapses that contributed to the stampede.
  • The incident occurred on December 4, 2024, when a large crowd gathered for the film's premiere, anticipating the arrival of lead actors.
  • A woman died due to suffocation in the crowd, despite prompt medical attention.
  • Police found multiple lapses in crowd management and safety measures at the theatre.
  • The management did not inform police of actor Allu Arjun's arrival, leading to a chaotic situation.
  • There was inadequate crowd control, with no separate entry for celebrities and insufficient security personnel present.
  • The theatre has a combined capacity of 2520 persons, with poor signage and crowd management policies.
  • Unused security measures, like a single metal detector, were in place, failing to screen the crowd effectively.
  • The police have registered a case against the management under several acts related to public safety.
  • The theatre management must respond to the show cause notice within 10 days to avoid further legal repercussions.
“It was clearly visible that the management has failed to provide a safe and secure environment to the public who is coming to the theatre.” - Hyderabad Police

This incident highlights the critical need for improved safety measures and crowd management at public events to prevent tragedies in the future.
newTitle: Hyderabad Police Identify 11 Lapses After Pushpa-2 Stampede at Sandhya Theatre

The controversy raises questions about the line between humor and offense in comedy, leaving audiences to debate whether Kapil's comments were misinterpreted.
